title: Gulf War and Health, Volume 1: Depleted Uranium, Pyridostigmine
description:
| Dedicated to those who died at the hands of a madman while the world did nothing but boast, bicker, and buck-pass.



The men and women who served in the Gulf War theater were potentially exposed to a wide range of biological and chemical agents. Gulf War and Health: Volume 1 assesses the scientific literature concerning the association between these agents and the adverse health effects currently experienced by a large number of veterans.


About the Author
Carolyn E. Fulco, Catharyn T. Liverman, Harold C. Sox, Editors, Committee on Health Effects Associated with Exposures During the Gulf War, Division of Health Promotion and Disease Prevention 



Paperback: 408 pages
Publisher: National Academies Press; 1 edition (December 15, 2000)
Language: English
ISBN-10: 030907178X
ISBN-13: 979-0309071788
